column4: I agree -- if it's been hanging for two hours, it's probably not worth waiting any longer. Is it an update-manager process, or did you do it on the command line?
It is running the update-manager
I can use the console anyway
I would do a 'sudo killall update-manager', then 'sudo dpkg --configure -a' and 'sudo apt-get -f install' (repeat until you don't get any errors)
the update is for the whole system
isn't every update for the whole system?
I mean that its the upgrade from 7.10 to 8.04
I see. Still, that's what I would do.
I cant find any "update-manager" process
can you kill it with the X button on rght of the top panel? Do the force quit if it asks you to
killed the locale process and now it is going on, but problems with locale, gnome-base-locale and Java related
see if you can resolve those with the two commands I gave you above
also problems with eclipse, ubuntu-minimal, ... Now it is finishing the updgrade, and I hope I can fix the rest after it finishes
what's up with your earlier problem?

I'm trying to go on with the upgrade and then fix the locale stuff. Now it has appeared again I cannot "jump" I cannot kill the process of localedef. I did kill the rest of locale procs and It has continued, but I'm too close to the end to start again
is it bug #249340 you're looking at?
Not at all, what is taht all about?
upgrade hanging on locales -- sounds like the issue you're having
I will tell  you all about, if you show me how to go on with the upgrade
please look at the bug report yourself -- you're in a much better position than I am to diagnose the problems on your machine
Asuka, VSpike: could you take Windows discussions to a more appropriate channel please?
is there a channel about VMWare?
check your channel list
ok, thank you
